episodes.title: Meeting with Detective Mori
episodes.description: Kogoro Mori, a famous detective, is approached by Shogo Somei and Miiko Kuzumi. They propose a special program that covers detectives 24 hours a day. Kogoro agrees to participate due to the involvement of Yoko Okino, a popular celebrity. During the discussion, Ran notices the matching watches worn by Shogo and Miiko, hinting at their close relationship.

episodes.title: Incident at Raisaku's Apartment
episodes.description: On a rainy day, Kogoro, Conan, and Ran visit producer Raisaku Nakame's apartment for a meeting. Shogo arrives late, soaked despite having driven there. Concerned about Raisaku's recent scandal, they break into the apartment and find Raisaku dead.

episodes.title: Incident at Raisaku Nakame's Living Room
episodes.description: Raisaku is found dead from cyanide poisoning. The scene includes a spilled cup of coffee and signs suggesting suicide. However, Conan discovers that the coffee cup was intentionally placed on a support plate later, indicating evidence manipulation. He also finds coffee marks on the chair legs far apart, suggesting the chair was moved.

evidence_collected.description: under the cup, suggesting post-crime manipulation.

episodes.title: doubt about Shogo
episodes.description: Shogo is suspected to be the culprit. Conan calls the pharmacy to confirm Shogo's alibi. It's revealed that Shogo was at the pharmacy at 6:30 PM, the estimated time of death. Additionally, Shogo did not take leave on the day of the murder, meaning he should not have been at Raisaku's house. Shogo did not inform the police about this alibi.

evidence_collected.description: confirming Shogo's presence at the pharmacy during the estimated time of death.

episodes.title: deep observation of the scene
episodes.description: Conan uncovers the key trick used by Shogo to manipulate the crime scene. Shogo combined cakes on one plate and used a writing instrument holder to disguise an additional cup as one used by Raisaku alone. Originally, there were two plates of cakes and two coffee cups.

evidence_collected.description: in Shogo's jacket, used to manipulate evidence.

evidence_collected.type: Two plates and two coffee cups

episodes.title: detection of the criminal
episodes.description: Conan reveals that Miiko Kuzumi is the real culprit. She poisoned Raisaku's coffee to protect Shogo from Raisaku's threats. After committing the crime, Miiko called Shogo to confess her love before jumping out of the window. Shogo hid her body in his car trunk to protect her reputation.
